# ipybox mcp-name: io.github.gradion-ai/ipybox

> [!NOTE] > **Next generation ipybox** > > This is the next generation of ipybox, a complete rewrite. Older versions are maintained on the [0.6.x branch](https://github.com/gradion-ai/ipybox/tree/0.6.x) and can be obtained with `pip install ipybox<0.7`. [ipybox](https://gradion-ai.github.io/ipybox/) is a Python code execution sandbox with first-class support for programmatic MCP tool calling. It generates a typed Python tool API from MCP server tool schemas, supporting both local stdio and remote HTTP servers. Code that calls the generated API executes in a sandboxed IPython kernel, providing a stateful environment where variables and definitions persist across executions. The generated API delegates MCP tool execution to a separate environment that enforces tool call approval, requiring applications to explicitly accept or reject each tool call before it executes. ![Architecture](docs/images/architecture-light-annotated.jpg) *`CodeExecutor` coordinates sandboxed code execution, tool execution, and tool call approval.* ## Documentation: - ðŸ“š [Documentation](https://gradion-ai.github.io/ipybox/) - ðŸ¤– [llms.txt](https://gradion-ai.github.io/ipybox/llms.txt) - ðŸ¤– [llms-full.txt](https://gradion-ai.github.io/ipybox/llms-full.txt) ## Agent integration ipybox is designed for agents that interact with their environment through [code actions](https://arxiv.org/abs/2402.01030) rather than JSON tool calls, a more reliable approach since LLMs are heavily pretrained on Python code compared to JSON tool call post-training. Agents generate and execute Python code that composes multiple MCP tool calls into a single action, using loops, conditionals, and data transformations that keep intermediate results out of the agent's context window. Since agent-generated code cannot be trusted, it must run in a secure sandboxed environment, and all MCP tool calls must be approved by the application. ipybox supports both with minimal setup. > [!TIP] > **freeact** > > A code action agent built on ipybox is [freeact](https://github.com/gradion-ai/freeact). In addition to inheriting the [features](#features) of ipybox, it supports progressive loading of tools and [agent skills](https://agentskills.io), and can save successful code actions as tools, evolving its own tool library over time. ## Features - **Stateful code execution** â€” state persists across executions in IPython kernels - **Lightweight sandboxing** â€” kernel isolation via Anthropic's [sandbox-runtime](https://github.com/anthropic-experimental/sandbox-runtime) - **Generated Python tool API** â€” functions and models generated from MCP tool schemas - **Programmatic MCP tool calling** â€” MCP tools called via Python code, not JSON directly - **MCP tool call approval** â€” every MCP tool call requires application-level approval - **Any MCP server** â€” supports stdio, Streamable HTTP, and SSE transports - **Any Python package** â€” install and use any Python package in IPython kernels - **Local code execution** â€” no cloud dependencies, everything runs on your machine - **Python SDK and MCP server** â€” use ipybox programmatically or as an MCP server - **Claude Code plugin** â€” a plugin for [programmatic tool calling in Claude Code](https://gradion-ai.github.io/ipybox/ccplugin/)
